intro: Philippia betsileana, commonly known as the Betsilean starling plant, is a rare flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its unique, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are usually opposite and elliptical, with a smooth texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Philippia betsileana is considered a species of conservation concern.
